scheme_name: National Scheme of Incentive to Girls for Secondary Education
description: The National Scheme of Incentive to Girls for Secondary Education aims to promote enrollment and retention of girl children belonging to disadvantaged sections at the secondary education level. The scheme focuses on girls aged 14–18 years who pass Class 8 but are at risk of dropping out due to socio-economic reasons. The objective is to encourage girls to continue education up to Class 12 and reduce dropout rates.
benefits: An amount of ₹3,000 is deposited as a fixed or term deposit in the name of each eligible girl child in a public sector bank or post office. The deposit matures when the girl child attains the age of 18 years. No premature withdrawal is allowed.
eligibility: The applicant must be a girl child aged between 14 and 18 years. She should belong to Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe categories, or have passed Class 8 from Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas irrespective of caste. The applicant must be enrolled in Class 9 in a State or UT Government school, Government-aided school, or local body school from the academic year 2008–09 onwards.
relaxation_priority: Girl children belonging to SC/ST categories and those educated in Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas are given priority. The scheme excludes married girls and students studying in private unaided or Central Government schools.
application_process: Applications are submitted online through the National Scholarships Portal (NSP). Students must register, fill out the application form, upload required documents, and submit the form for verification. Payment status can be tracked through the PFMS portal using Aadhaar number, bank account number, or NSP application ID.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, domicile certificate, income certificate of parents or guardian, Class 10th scorecard, certificate from school head confirming continuation after Class 9, current class fee receipt, bank account proof, and disability certificate if applicable.
faqs: Frequently asked questions include eligibility conditions, deposit withdrawal rules, exclusion criteria, required documents, and tracking scholarship payment status.

scheme_name: Scholarships For Higher Education Abroad To Meritorious Boys And Girls From Open Category
description: This scholarship scheme was launched by the Department of Higher and Technical Education, Government of Maharashtra on 4th October 2018. It supports meritorious students from the open category who wish to pursue Post Graduation, Diploma after Graduation, or Ph.D. studies abroad in top-ranked international universities.
benefits: The government pays the full tuition fee charged by the foreign university, covers full personal health insurance costs, provides subsistence allowance (GBP 9,900 for the UK and USD 15,400 for other countries), and offers one-time economy class airfare for international travel.
eligibility: The applicant and their parents or guardian must be Indian citizens and residents of Maharashtra. The applicant must belong to the open or unreserved category, with reserved category students allowed if applying under open category. An unconditional offer letter from a foreign university ranked within the top 200 as per THE or QS rankings is required. Annual family income must be below ₹8,00,000.
relaxation_priority: Selection is based on merit and course-wise seat availability. A total of 20 students are selected every year across disciplines such as Arts, Commerce, Science, Management, Law, Engineering, Architecture, and Pharmacology.
application_process: Applications are invited online every year through the Directorate of Technical Education, Maharashtra portal. Applicants must register, submit required details online, and await scrutiny and merit list publication by the department.
documents_required: Identity proof, Maharashtra domicile certificate, income certificate, unconditional offer letter from the foreign institution, educational qualification certificates, passport, and no-objection certificate if employed.
faqs: Common questions relate to income limits, eligible university rankings, covered expenses, number of scholarships available, and selection criteria.

scheme_name: Swami Vivekananda Single Girl Child Fellowship for Research in Social Sciences
description: A fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC) aimed at supporting single girl children pursuing Ph.D. research in Social Sciences. The scheme seeks to compensate for the direct costs of higher education, promote higher education among single girl children, and encourage observance of small family norms in society.
benefits: Monthly fellowship of ₹25,000 for the first two years and ₹28,000 for the remaining tenure. Annual contingency grant of ₹10,000 for the first two years and ₹20,500 for the remaining period. Escort reader assistance of ₹2,000 per month for PWD candidates.
tenure: The fellowship is awarded for a maximum period of five years or until submission of the Ph.D. thesis, whichever is earlier. No extension beyond five years is permitted.
eligibility: The applicant must be a single girl child with no brothers or sisters, or twin daughters only, pursuing a full-time regular Ph.D. in Social Sciences. The institution must be recognized under UGC Act sections 2(f) and 12(b), deemed universities, government-funded institutions, or institutes of national importance. Age limit is up to 40 years for General category and 45 years for SC/ST/OBC/PWD candidates. Distance education Ph.D. programs are not eligible. Transgender candidates are eligible as per norms.
relaxation_priority: Age relaxation is provided for reserved categories (SC/ST/OBC/PWD). Escort reader assistance is provided for PWD candidates. Hostel or HRA benefits depend on accommodation availability as per Government of India norms.
application_process: Applications are invited once a year through online mode via notifications published in leading newspapers, Employment News, and the official UGC website. Candidates must apply strictly according to the instructions provided on the online portal. Incomplete applications are rejected.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, proof of identity, proof of age (Class 10th marksheet or birth certificate), bank details, proof of pursuing Ph.D. in Social Sciences, passport-size photograph, caste certificate if applicable, disability certificate if applicable, transgender ID card if applicable, and an affidavit proving single girl child status on ₹50 stamp paper attested by a competent authority.
faqs: Common queries relate to eligibility of twin daughters, age limits, fellowship tenure, contingency grants, hostel and HRA rules, and document requirements.

scheme_name: Pragati Scholarship Scheme for Girl Students (Technical Diploma)
implementing_agency: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
description: The Pragati Scholarship Scheme for Girl Students (Technical Diploma) is an initiative by AICTE under the Ministry of Education to support and empower girl students pursuing technical diploma education in AICTE-approved institutions. The scheme aims to encourage higher education among women by providing financial assistance to meet educational expenses and build self-confidence through knowledge and skill development.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50,000 per annum as a lump sum amount for each year of study. The scholarship is provided for a maximum of three years for first-year admitted students and a maximum of two years for second-year admitted students through lateral entry. The amount may be used for college fees, purchase of computer, books, stationery, equipment, software, etc. No additional grants for hostel or medical expenses are provided.
tenure: Up to 3 years for students admitted in the first year of the diploma course and up to 2 years for students admitted in the second year through lateral entry, subject to satisfactory academic progress.
eligibility: The applicant must be a girl student pursuing either the first year or second year (through lateral entry) of a technical diploma course in an AICTE-approved institution. The annual family income from all sources must not exceed ₹8,00,000. A maximum of two girl children per family are eligible. All eligible applicants from 13 specified Union Territories and North Eastern States are assured scholarship support.
exclusions: The scholarship will be discontinued if the student fails or drops out in any subsequent year. Students receiving financial assistance from any other scholarship, stipend, salary, or emoluments are not eligible. Applicants with a gap of more than two years between qualifying examination and admission are excluded. The scholarship is limited to a maximum of two girl children per family.
application_process: Applications are submitted online through the National Scholarships Portal (NSP). Students must complete new registration, obtain an application ID and password, log in to fill the application form, upload required documents, and submit the form. Verification of credentials is carried out through DigiLocker integration. Applicants can save the form as draft or submit it finally before the deadline.
documents_required: SSC/10th certificate, HSC/12th certificate (for degree level cases), ITI certificate (for lateral entry diploma), diploma certificate (for lateral entry degree), bank passbook, category certificate, Aadhaar card, passport-size photograph, study certificate (Appendix-I), annual family income certificate (Appendix-II), parent's declaration (Appendix-III), and bank mandate form (Appendix-IV).
faqs: Frequently asked questions include eligibility conditions, income limits, number of beneficiaries per family, scholarship tenure, renewal criteria, and payment tracking through PFMS.

scheme_name: CBSE Merit Scholarship Scheme For Single Girl Child
description: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Education for meritorious Single Girl Students, who are the only child of their parents; and have passed the CBSE Class 10th Examination with 60% or more marks and are continuing their further school education of Class 11th and 12th. The scheme is aimed to recognize the efforts of the parents in promoting education among girls and to provide encouragement to meritorious students. The tuition fee should not be more than ₹1,500/- per month during the academic year, shall be considered for the purpose. In the next two years, the total enhancement in tuition fees in such a school shall not be more than 10% of the tuition fee charged. The scholarship shall be awarded to Indian Nationals only.
benefits: The rate of the scholarship shall be Rupees Five Hundred (₹500/-) per month. A Scholarship awarded under the scheme shall be paid for a maximum period of two years. Payment will be made through ECS/NEFT.
tenure: The scholarship is awarded for a maximum period of two years, covering Class 11th and 12th.
eligibility: The applicant should be the single girl child of her family. The applicant should have secured 60% or more marks in the CBSE Class 10th Examination and be studying Class 11th & 12th in a school affiliated with CBSE. The tuition fee should not be more than ₹1,500/- per month during the academic year (₹6,000/- per month for NRI applicants). In the next two years, the total enhancement in tuition fees in such a school shall not be more than 10% of the tuition fee charged. The applicant must be an Indian National (NRI applicants of the Board are also eligible). The student must continue her school studies in Classes 11th and 12th. The applicant should have passed the CBSE Class 10th Examination in the relevant year (e.g., 2019) to be considered.
relaxation_priority: NRI applicants are eligible with a higher tuition fee limit of ₹6,000/- per month. A beneficiary under the scheme while availing of the scholarship can enjoy other concessions given by the school or other organization(s).
application_process: Applications are submitted online via the CBSE official website. New applicants click on 'New user Registration', while existing applicants click on 'Renewal'. After reading instructions, applicants fill in roll number and DOB as per Class 10 mark sheet. Required documents (undertaking and affidavit) must be printed, filled, attested, scanned, and uploaded as PDF files not exceeding 1 MB. Upon successful application, a confirmation page appears which must be printed. For renewal, the duly filled and signed confirmation page must be couriered to: Assistant Secretary (Scholarship), CBSE, Shiksha Kendra, 2 Community Centre, Preet Vihar, Delhi - 110 092.
documents_required: Caste certificate (if applicable), income certificate and admission proof, details of bank account and fees structure, passport size photos and scanned signature, student's ID card, Class 11th mark sheet for scholarship renewal, bank account linked Aadhaar card, bank passbook, and canceled cheque. An affidavit on ₹50 stamp paper from the girl or her parents duly attested by a gazette officer (SDM or first-class magistrate, not below the rank of tehsildar) declaring that the girl child belongs to a specific family and is the single child.
faqs: Common queries relate to eligibility for NRIs, tuition fee limits, scholarship renewal process, document attestation requirements, and the application timeline based on the Class 10 passing year.

scheme_name: Pragati Scholarship Scheme for Girl Students (Technical Degree)
implementing_agency: All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)
description: The Pragati Scholarship Scheme for Girl Students (Technical Degree) is an initiative by AICTE under the Ministry of Education to encourage and support girl students pursuing technical degree education in AICTE-approved institutions. The scheme aims to empower women through education, skill development, and self-confidence by providing financial assistance for higher education.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50,000 per annum as a lump sum amount for each year of study. The scholarship is provided for a maximum of four years for students admitted in the first year of the degree course and a maximum of three years for students admitted in the second year through lateral entry. The amount can be used for college fees, purchase of computers, books, stationery, equipment, software, and other educational expenses.
tenure: Up to 4 years for first-year admitted students and up to 3 years for second-year admitted students through lateral entry, subject to continuation of studies and satisfactory academic progress.
eligibility: The applicant must be a girl student pursuing either the first year or second year (through lateral entry) of a technical degree course in an AICTE-approved institution. The annual family income from all sources must not exceed ₹8,00,000 per annum. A maximum of two girl children per family are eligible. All eligible applicants from the specified 13 Union Territories and North Eastern States are assured scholarship support.
exclusions: The scholarship will be discontinued if the student fails or drops out in any subsequent year. Students receiving financial assistance from any other source such as scholarships, stipends, or salaries are not eligible. Applicants with a gap of more than two years between passing the qualifying examination and admission are excluded. The scholarship is limited to a maximum of two girl children per family.
application_process: Applications must be submitted online through the National Scholarships Portal (NSP). Applicants must complete new registration, log in using the application ID and password, fill out the application form, upload required documents, and submit the application. Verification of student credentials is carried out through DigiLocker integration.
documents_required: SSC/10th certificate, HSC/12th certificate (for degree level), ITI certificate (for lateral entry diploma cases), diploma certificate (for lateral entry degree cases), bank passbook, category certificate, Aadhaar card, study certificate (Appendix-I), annual family income certificate (Appendix-II), parent's declaration (Appendix-III), and bank mandate form (Appendix-IV).
faqs: Common queries include eligibility criteria, income limits, number of beneficiaries per family, scholarship duration, renewal conditions, and payment tracking through PFMS.

description: A Research Grant by the Ministry of Science and Technology (MoST/DST) for female candidates to pursue research in frontier areas of science and engineering. The scheme is particularly aimed at women who have had a break in their career (minimum two years) and do not have regular employment, to explore the possibility of re-entry into the profession. Support is available in 5 disciplines: i) Physical & Mathematical Sciences (PMS), ii) Chemical Sciences (CS), iii) Life Sciences (LS), iv) Earth & Atmospheric Sciences (EAS), and v) Engineering Technology (ET). The scheme provides a research grant for a well-defined project proposal for a maximum period of three years. It plays a pivotal role in gender mainstreaming by preventing brain drain from the S&T system and training and retaining women scientists, ultimately opening avenues for permanent positions.
benefits: The grant covers the applicant's fellowship and costs for small equipment, contingencies, travel, and consumables. Institutional overhead charges are extra. Fellowship amounts are: Rs. 55,000/- per month (plus HRA as applicable) for Ph.D. or equivalent (total project cost not exceeding Rs. 30 lakh); Rs. 40,000/- per month (plus HRA) for M.Phil./M.Tech or equivalent (total project cost not exceeding Rs. 25 lakh); Rs. 31,000/- per month (plus HRA) for M.Sc. or equivalent (total project cost not exceeding Rs. 20 lakh). The benefits are provided for a maximum period of three years. Payment is made through DBT.
tenure: The research grant is awarded for a maximum period of three years.
eligibility: The applicant must be a FEMALE candidate. The applicant must either be unemployed or in a position other than a regular/permanent position. The age of the applicant must be between 27 and 57 years (with a 5-year relaxation for SC/ST/OBC and physically challenged candidates). The applicant must hold a minimum essential qualification: a Post Graduate degree equivalent to M.Sc. in Basic or Applied Sciences, or B.Tech., MBBS, or other equivalent professional qualifications; OR M.Phil/M.Tech/M.Pharm/M.VSc or equivalent; OR a Ph.D. in Basic or Applied Sciences. Women in permanent positions are NOT eligible to apply.
relaxation_priority: Age relaxation of 5 years is provided for SC/ST/OBC and physically challenged candidates. The scheme prioritizes women who have had a career break of at least two years.
application_process: Applications are submitted exclusively online. Step 1: Register at the portal https://online-wosa.gov.in/wosa/ using an active email ID. Step 2: After logging in, fill and submit the full Project Proposal Document (PPD) under WOS-A, including uploading all required documents in specified formats. Step 3: Preview the full proposal before final submission, as editing is not allowed after submission. Step 4: Click the 'Final Submit' button. The proposal is saved in the system and can be printed. There is NO requirement to submit a hard copy to DST.
documents_required: Project Proposal Document (PPD - format available on source portal), Biodata of Principal Investigator (PI) - Signed, Mentor’s Biodata - Signed, Caste Certificate (if applicable for SC/ST/OBC/PwD), Date of Birth certificate (10th class marksheet or equivalent), Photograph of PI, Signature of PI, Certificate of Highest Degree, House Rent Allowance declaration (if eligible - format on source portal).
faqs: Common queries relate to eligibility regarding career breaks and employment status, age relaxation, project cost ceilings based on qualification, the disciplines covered, and the online submission process without hard copies.

scheme_name: Savitribai Phule Scholarship for V.J.N.T and S.B.C Girls Students Studying in 8th to 10th Standard
ministry: Social Justice and Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra
description: The Savitribai Phule Scholarship Scheme is an initiative by the Social Justice and Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra, to encourage school enrollment and reduce dropout rates among girl students belonging to Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) and Special Backward Classes (SBC). The scheme targets girls studying in classes 8th to 10th and has been implemented since the academic year 2003-04.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹100 per month for 10 months, totaling ₹1,000 per academic year, to support the education of eligible girl students.
tenure: The scholarship is provided for the duration of the academic year for students studying in 8th, 9th, or 10th standard, subject to continued eligibility.
eligibility: The applicant must be a girl student belonging to Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) or Special Backward Classes (SBC). The student must be studying in 8th to 10th standard in Maharashtra. There is no income limit and no minimum marks requirement under this scheme.
relaxation_priority: No income limit and no academic performance criteria are applied, ensuring wider access for eligible VJNT and SBC girl students.
application_process: Applications are submitted online through the MahaDBT portal. Applicants must complete new registration, verify mobile number and email via OTP, link Aadhaar with bank account, complete profile details, select the Savitribai Phule Scholarship from the list of schemes, upload required documents, and submit the application. Applicants can track application status through the portal.
documents_required: Aadhaar number, proof of identity, proof of age (birth certificate), proof of address, domicile certificate of Maharashtra, caste certificate for VJNT or SBC category issued by an authorized revenue officer, marksheet of latest educational qualification, fee receipt of current academic year, bank account details, and passport-size photograph.
faqs: Frequently asked questions relate to caste eligibility, applicable class standards, absence of income and marks criteria, application steps on MahaDBT, and tracking of application status.

scheme_name: Rajarshri Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Merit Scholarship
ministry: Department of Social Justice and Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra
description: The 'Rajarshri Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj Merit Scholarship' scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra, specifically designed to encourage Scheduled Caste (SC) students to pursue higher secondary education. The scholarship aims to enhance the educational standards and competitiveness of SC students by providing financial assistance to those who excel in their Class 10th examinations and are admitted to Class 11th in recognized junior colleges or colleges.
benefits: Scholarship Rate: ₹300/- per month for Class 11th and ₹300/- per month for Class 12th. Duration: Ten months per academic year. Total: ₹3,000 per academic year.
tenure: The scholarship is awarded for the duration of Class 11th and Class 12th (two academic years), payable for ten months each year.
eligibility: The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. The applicant must be studying in Class 11th or 12th in a recognized Junior College or College. The applicant must have passed the Class 10th examination with 75% or more marks. Backward-class students (Scheduled Caste) who have been admitted to Class 11th in a junior college/college are eligible for this scholarship.
relaxation_priority: The scheme is exclusively for Scheduled Caste (SC) students. There is a high merit requirement of 75% in Class 10th.
application_process: Application Process is Offline. Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) their respective junior college or college and request a hard copy of the prescribed application form from the designated staff. Step 2: Fill in all mandatory fields in the application form and attach self-attested copies of all required documents. Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with documents to the Principal of the respective junior college or college. Step 4: Obtain a receipt or acknowledgment from the Principal containing details like date, time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). Proposal Submission by Principals: Principals of recognized junior colleges and colleges must submit a compiled list of eligible students to the Special District Social Welfare Officer by the end of June each year.
documents_required: Caste Certificate (issued by the competent authority), Class 10th Mark Sheet (showing 75% or more marks), School Leaving Certificate, College Admission Certificate (from a recognized junior college or college).
faqs: Common queries relate to the high merit threshold (75% in Class 10th), the offline application process through colleges, the timeline for submission by principals (end of June), and the exclusive focus on Scheduled Caste students.

scheme_name: Savitribai Jyotirao Phule Fellowship for Single Girl Child
description: A fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education, for supporting single girl children pursuing research work leading to the award of a Ph.D. degree. The scheme targets 'single girl child' - the only girl child in the family without any brother or sister. Twin daughters are also eligible. The scheme promotes higher education of single girl children, recognizes the value of small family norms, and propagates the concept of single girl child in society.
benefits: Fellowship: ₹31,000 per month for initial two years as JRF, ₹35,000 per month thereafter as SRF. Contingency grant: For Humanities & Social Sciences: ₹10,000 p.a. for first two years, ₹20,500 p.a. thereafter. For Science, Engineering & Technology: ₹12,000 p.a. for first two years, ₹25,000 p.a. thereafter. Escort reader assistance: ₹3,000 per month for Divyang scholars. HRA as per Govt. of India norms based on accommodation availability.
tenure: Maximum of five years or until submission of Ph.D. thesis, whichever is earlier. Effective from 1st April of selection year or actual joining date. No extension beyond five years permitted.
eligibility: Applicant must be a single girl child (only girl without brothers or sisters) or one of twin daughters. Must be pursuing full-time regular Ph.D. in any stream/subject at recognized Universities/Colleges/Institutes. Age limit: up to 40 years for General category, 45 years for SC/ST/OBC/PWD candidates as on last application date. Part-time/distance education Ph.D. programs not eligible.
relaxation_priority: Age relaxation for SC/ST/OBC/PWD categories. Escort reader assistance for Divyang scholars. HRA benefits subject to accommodation availability as per Govt. of India norms. Maternity/paternity leave as per Govt. norms. Intermittent break up to 1 year for women scholars.
application_process: Applications invited annually through online mode via advertisements in leading newspapers, Employment News, and UGC website. Process includes: 1. Registration on FRG portal, 2. Login with credentials, 3. Fill eligibility criteria, 4. Submit PG and Ph.D. details, 5. Upload required documents, 6. Final declaration and submission. No hard copies accepted.
documents_required: Passport-size photograph and signature (jpg, upto 1MB). Complete research proposal (upto 5MB) and abstract (upto 1MB). Auto-generated application form signed by HoD/Registrar. Affidavit proving single girl child status on ₹100 stamp paper attested by SDM/First Class Magistrate/Tahsildar (or guardian if parents deceased).
faqs: Common queries relate to eligibility of twin daughters, age relaxation for reserved categories, part-time/distance education eligibility, fellowship tenure, contingency grants for different streams, HRA rules, and leave provisions including maternity and intermittent breaks.

scheme_name: Deen Dayal Upadhyay Grameen Kaushalya Yojana
description: The scheme 'Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY)' is a skill training and placement program of the Ministry of Rural Development (MoRD). The program focuses on the rural poor youth and emphasizes sustainable employment through post-placement tracking, retention, and career progression. DDU-GKY is designed to provide high-quality skill training opportunities to the rural poor and establish a larger ecosystem that supports trained candidates to secure a better future. It aims to skill rural youth who are poor and provide them with jobs having regular monthly wages at or above the minimum wage.
benefits: Skill Training: Industry-relevant training in sectors like agriculture, construction, retail, and hospitality. Placement Assistance: Connects beneficiaries with potential employers and provides job search support like resume writing and interview preparation. Post-Placement Support: Includes mentorship, counseling, and resource access to help adjust to new jobs. Career Progression Support: Offers training, mentorship, and networking to help advance careers. Incentives for Higher Placements: Provides incentives to Project Implementing Agencies (PIAs) for placing beneficiaries in higher-paying jobs.
tenure: The skill training duration varies by trade/sector. The program includes post-placement support and career progression tracking for a sustainable employment outcome.
eligibility: The target group is poor rural youth aged 15-35. The upper age limit for women candidates, and candidates belonging to Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs), Persons with Disabilities (PwDs), Transgender and other Special Groups (rehabilitated bonded labor, victims of trafficking, manual scavengers, trans-genders, HIV-positive persons, etc.) is 45 years. The poor are identified by Participatory Identification of Poor (PIP). Until PIP is fully implemented, eligibility extends to youth from: MGNREGA worker households (with at least 15 days work in the previous FY), households with an RSBY card, households with Antyodaya Anna Yojana / BPL PDS cards, households with an SHG member under NRLM, and households covered under auto inclusion parameters of SECC 2011.
relaxation_priority: Age relaxation up to 45 years for women, PVTG, PwD, transgender, and other specified special groups. The program prioritizes the rural poor from identified vulnerable categories.
application_process: Applications are submitted online via the Kaushal Panjee portal. Step 1: Visit the official website. Step 2: Click 'Candidate Registration' in the left pane. Step 3: Select 'Fresh/New Registration' and click 'Next'. Step 4: Fill in all mandatory fields, upload required documents, and click 'Submit'. Note the Registration ID for future reference.
documents_required: Proof of Identity, Proof of Age, BPL Card (if applicable), MGNREGA Card (if applicable), RSBY Card (if applicable), AAY Card (if applicable), SHG Identification (if applicable), Disability Certificate issued by competent authority (if applicable), ST/SC Certificate issued by competent authority (if applicable), Self-Certification by the candidate for minority community status (if applicable).
faqs: Common queries relate to the age relaxation for special groups, eligibility criteria for non-BPL youth through alternative identification methods, the sectors covered for training, and the post-placement support mechanism.

scheme_name: Loan Based Schemes For Safai Karamchari - Education Loan Scheme (ELS)
ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
description: An Education Loan scheme by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, implemented through the National Safai Karamcharis Finance and Development Corporation (NSKFDC), for Safai Karamcharis (including Waste Pickers), identified Manual Scavengers, and their dependents aged 18 years and above. Under this scheme, term loans are extended through State Channelising Agencies (SCAs), Regional Rural Banks (RRBs), and Nationalised Banks to the target group to pursue professional and technical courses. The interest on Education Loan for study in India is reimbursable under a separate scheme of the Ministry of Education for beneficiaries whose family annual income is up to ₹4.50 lakh per annum.
benefits: Educational Loan: Up to 90% of the unit cost with a maximum of ₹10.00 lakh for study in India and ₹20.00 lakh for study abroad, at an interest rate of 4% per annum. A 0.5% per annum rebate is available for women studying in India. The promoter's contribution is 10% to be arranged by the student/Channelising Agencies. Repayment Period: 5 years after completion of the course, with interest payable quarterly from loan disbursement. Moratorium Period: 1 year. Coverage: The loan may cover Admission & Tuition Fees, Books, Stationery, Instruments, Examination Fees, Boarding and Lodging expenses, and Insurance premium.
tenure: The loan has a repayment period of 5 years after the co-termination of the course, with a 1-year moratorium period.
eligibility: The scheme is for: Safai Karamcharis (including Waste Pickers), identified Manual Scavengers and their dependents. Eligibility requires a certificate from a competent authority (Local Revenue Officer, Municipal Officer, Cantonment Executive Officer, Gazetted Officer of Govt. Departments, Elected Municipal Member, Pradhan of Gram Panchayat, or Regional Managers of RRBs/PSBs). Persons identified as Manual Scavengers in a survey under the MS Act, 2013 are exempt from providing a certificate once their name appears in the final state/UT list. Registered co-operative societies, legally constituted associations/firms of the target group are also eligible.
relaxation_priority: Women borrowers receive a 0.5% per annum interest rebate for study in India. The scheme is exclusively targeted at Safai Karamcharis, Manual Scavengers, and their dependents.
application_process: The application process is Offline. Step 1: Applicants submit loan applications to the district offices of State Channelising Agencies (SCAs) of NSKFDC, or to RRBs and Nationalised Banks. Step 2: These applications are sent to the head offices where the project proposal is appraised. Step 3: The appraised projects are sent to NSKFDC with recommendations. Step 4: NSKFDC's Project Appraisal Committee appraises proposals and, if found satisfactory, presents them to the Board of Directors for approval. Step 5: Upon Board approval, the sanction letter is issued by the SCA/RRB/Nationalised Bank. Step 6: After acceptance of terms, documents are executed, and funds are released to the beneficiary.
documents_required: Indicative Documents: Aadhaar Card, Income Certificate, Caste Certificate, Bank Account Statement, Educational Certificates, Occupation/Category Certificate from competent authority (as per eligibility criteria), Admission proof and fee structure from the institution.
faqs: Common queries relate to the definition of 'dependents', the process for obtaining the mandatory occupation certificate, the interest reimbursement process from the Ministry of Education, the difference in loan limits for India and abroad, and the role of Channelising Agencies.

scheme_name: Scholarship Scheme for Girl Children of Jute Mills / MSMEs Workers
description: The Scholarship Scheme for Girl Children of Jute Mills / MSMEs Workers is a welfare initiative under the National Jute Board Act, 2008. The scheme aims to support the education of girl children of workers engaged in jute mills and jute-based MSMEs by providing financial incentives upon successful completion of secondary and higher secondary education. It also seeks to improve worker retention, strengthen mill-worker relationships, and promote women empowerment through education.
objectives: To encourage education among girl children of jute industry workers, reduce dropout rates, support women empowerment, motivate workers to remain in the jute industry, reduce labor attrition, improve labor stability in jute mills and MSMEs, and enhance the social security of workers' families.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹5,000 for passing the Secondary examination and ₹10,000 for passing the Higher Secondary examination, applicable only for girl students.
tenure: The scheme covers examinations passed during the academic years 2021-22 to 2025-26, corresponding to the 15th Finance Commission period.
eligibility: The applicant must be a girl child of a worker employed in a Jute Mill or Jute-based MSME/JDP unit engaged in the production of jute products. The scholarship is applicable to girls who have passed Secondary or Higher Secondary examinations during the specified academic years from 2021-22 to 2025-26.
application_process: Applications are submitted offline. Jute Mills must scrutinize and verify applications, certify the correctness of information, attach the current pay slip of the worker, and forward the applications to IJMA. JDP units or Jute MSMEs must verify applications, attach the worker’s ESI Identity Certificate, and forward them to JPDEPC or other authorized institutions approved by the Monitoring Committee.
documents_required: Admit card of the examination passed, mark sheet of the examination passed, certificate issued by the examination board or council, Aadhaar card or Voter ID of the applicant, bank passbook copy (Aadhaar-linked account), current month's pay slip of the worker, ESI Identity Certificate of the worker (for JDP units), and a declaration or affidavit stating that no similar scholarship or financial benefit has been claimed from any State or Central Government department.
faqs: Common questions relate to eligibility years, applicable examinations, benefit amounts for secondary and higher secondary levels, offline application procedure through jute mills or MSMEs, and recovery of funds in case of false declaration.
